intro: Murdannia triquetra var. ahuchawlense, commonly known as the three-angled murdannia, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and wetlands. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous growth habit and a preference for well-drained, nutrient-rich soils. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
